results.title: Efficacy of platelet rich fibrin with and without metformin in the treatment of periodontal osseous defects: a systematic review and meta-analysis.
results.text_hl: OBJECTIVE: The systematic review and meta-analysis aimed to evaluate the efficacy of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ (@<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MF@@@) with Platelet Rich Fibrin (PRF) over PRF alone in the treatment of @DISEASE_Periodontitis @DISEASE_MESH:D010518 @@@periodontal osseous defects@@@.

citations.NLM: Ikhar AS, Kolte RA, Kolte AP, Purohit AR, Dahake RN. Efficacy of platelet rich fibrin with and without metformin in the treatment of periodontal osseous defects: a systematic review and meta-analysis. Acta Odontol Scand. 2022 Jul 4;():1-10. PMID: 35786379
citations.BibTeX: @article{35786379, title={Efficacy of platelet rich fibrin with and without metformin in the treatment of periodontal osseous defects: a systematic review and meta-analysis.}, author={Ikhar AS and Kolte RA and Kolte AP and Purohit AR and Dahake RN}, journal={Acta Odontol Scand}, pages={1-10}}

results.title: Efficacy of 1% Metformin Gel in Patients With Moderate and Severe Chronic Periodontitis: A Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial.
results.text_hl: A significantly greater mean DDR% was found in the @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MF@@@ group than the placebo group at 6 and 9 months in both subgroups, 5 to 7 and >7 mm of initial @<m>DISEASE_Inert_Gas_Narcosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007222 @@@PD@@@.

citations.NLM: Pradeep AR, Patnaik K, Nagpal K, Karvekar S, Guruprasad CN, Kumaraswamy KM. Efficacy of 1% Metformin Gel in Patients With Moderate and Severe Chronic Periodontitis: A Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial. J Periodontol. 2017 Oct;88(10):1023-1029. PMID: 28731373
citations.BibTeX: @article{28731373, title={Efficacy of 1% Metformin Gel in Patients With Moderate and Severe Chronic Periodontitis: A Randomized Controlled Clinical Trial.}, author={Pradeep AR and Patnaik K and Nagpal K and Karvekar S and Guruprasad CN and Kumaraswamy KM}, journal={J Periodontol}, volume={88}, number={10}, pages={1023-1029}}

results.title: Comparative evaluation of subgingivally delivered 1.2% rosuvastatin and 1% metformin gel in treatment of intrabony defects in chronic periodontitis: A randomized controlled clinical trial.
results.text_hl: RESULTS: mSBI, BP, @<m>DISEASE_Inert_Gas_Narcosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007222 @@@PD@@@, and CAL were improved in all the groups, however mean reductions in @<m>DISEASE_Inert_Gas_Narcosis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D007222 @@@PD@@@, CAL gain, and percentage of bone fill was found to be higher in @CHEMICAL_Rosuvastatin_Calcium @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000068718 @@@RSV@@@ and @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@MF@@@ groups than placebo group at all visits.

citations.NLM: Pankaj D, Sahu I, Kurian IG, Pradeep AR. Comparative evaluation of subgingivally delivered 1.2% rosuvastatin and 1% metformin gel in treatment of intrabony defects in chronic periodontitis: A randomized controlled clinical trial. J Periodontol. 2018 Nov;89(11):1318-1325. PMID: 29802627
